content: US government officials are concerned that the quality of the Global Positioning System (GPS) could begin to deteriorate as early as next year, resulting in regular blackouts and failures – or even dishing out inaccurate directions to millions of people worldwide. The satellites are overseen by the US Air Force, which has maintained the GPS network since the early 1990s. According to a study by the US government accountability office (GAO), mismanagement and a lack of investment means that some of the crucial GPS satellites could begin to fail as early as next year.
reply: US government officials are concerned that the quality of the Global Positioning System (GPS) could begin to deteriorate as early as next year, resulting in regular blackouts and failures – or even dishing out inaccurate directions to millions of people worldwide. The satellites are overseen by the US Air Force, which has maintained the GPS network since the early 1990s. According to a study by the US government accountability office (GAO), mismanagement and a lack of investment means that some of the crucial GPS satellites could begin to fail as early as next year.
title: no more gps?

Course then working in the mountains isn't like it was 30+ years ago..... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: Shoot, I've been a private pilot since 1972. Before GPS I spent most of my time semi lost. No I never got into any real trouble but GPS sure made my life easier. I do not think the government will let GPS go down. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?

content: I dont know how many people have been to any of the current areas of operation but I have and will say that with out GPS you are just lost in the desert. Once you get on a paved highway your fine but having to give Grids to Dustoff (for those that dont understand that is a Medical evacuation chopper) is very hard when you are doing every thing you can to stop bleeding. This is a very important tool to not only civilens so they can find their way around this country but the military as well.

content: quote: Originally posted by VeteranDad78: quote: "Booger Holler". I'd like to see that!! True place Vet...... just a spot on the road, had a general store/post office complete with a couple old timers in rockers and across the road from the store was a hamburger joint - "Home of the famous Booger Burger". We staged an ambush in the store parking lot (with permission) for the "Russians" who frequented the place. Oh how I dreampt of one of those "Booger Burgers" while on that FTX, but since we were the "good guys", and taken over by the evil Russians, we had to stay in hidding and could not risk being caught in the store...... lots of good stories out of that FTX for sure... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
quote: Originally posted by VeteranDad78: quote: "Booger Holler". I'd like to see that!!

content: when i was a pilot (civilian) i remember folding my map on a night flight in a 206 over the everglades with no doors on, and would you know it? whoosh, out the cockpit. anyone who knows the area knows at night it is pitch black with little or no ground reference. it took alot of putting my pride to the side but eventually i asked for vectors to my destination. they were happy to help but the one thing that kept me from trying to tough it out was another pilot landed at the wrong airport ( class b ), unnanounced, on the wrong freq, because he didnt know how to use his gps. that looked great for the company

content: quote: Originally posted by VeteranDad78: quote: "Booger Holler". I'd like to see that!! True place Vet...... just a spot on the road, had a general store/post office complete with a couple old timers in rockers and across the road from the store was a hamburger joint - "Home of the famous Booger Burger". We staged an ambush in the store parking lot (with permission) for the "Russians" who frequented the place. Oh how I dreampt of one of those "Booger Burgers" while on that FTX, but since we were the "good guys", and taken over by the evil Russians, we had to stay in hidding and could not risk being caught in the store...... lots of good stories out of that FTX for sure... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
